dict.string:
require 'json'
command = "{query}"
results = `#{command}` json = results.strip.split("\n").last parsed = JSON.parse(json)
permalink_url = parsed["permalink_url"]
`/usr/bin/open #{permalink_url}`
print parsed["url"]
Hit space key to toggle modes

on alfred_script(q) try global frontApp, frontAppName, windowTitle set windowTitle to "" tell application "System Events" set frontApp to first application process whose frontmost is true set frontAppName to name of frontApp tell process frontAppName tell (1st window whose value of attribute "AXMain" is true) set windowTitle to its title end tell end tell end tell set the clipboard to windowTitle end try end alfred_script

begin access_token_path = File.join(ENV['alfred_workflow_data'], ".gyazo_access_token") f = File.open(access_token_path, 'r') access_token = f.read.strip f.close if access_token == "" raise "Access Token is empty" else print access_token end rescue print "" end

on alfred_script(q) try tell application "System Events" set the clipboard to "" set frontApp to first application process whose frontmost is true set frontAppName to name of frontApp set theUrl to "" if frontAppName is "Google Chrome" then tell application "Google Chrome" set theUrl to URL of active tab of front window end tell else if frontAppName is "Safari" then tell application "Safari" set theUrl to URL of front document end tell else if frontAppName is "Firefox" then tell application "Firefox" to activate tell application "System Events" keystroke "l" using command down keystroke "c" using command down end tell delay 0.5 set theUrl to the clipboard end if return theUrl end tell end try end alfred_script

on run try set theAppTitle to the clipboard set theToken to (system attribute "access_token") set theImage to (system attribute "img_path") set theReferer to (system attribute "referer_url") set the clipboard to (system attribute "original_clipboard") set theOptions to "" display dialog "Input image Title (optional):" default button 2 default answer theAppTitle set tmpTitle to result if the button returned of tmpTitle is not "OK" then return "" end if set theTitle to text returned of tmpTitle set theOptions to theOptions & "--form-string \"title=" & theTitle & "\" " if theReferer is not "" then display dialog "Input Referer URL (optional):" default button 2 default answer theReferer set tmpReferer to result if the button returned of tmpReferer is not "OK" then return "" end if set theReferer to text returned of tmpReferer if theReferer is not "" then set theOptions to theOptions & "--form-string \"referer_url=" & theReferer & "\" " end if end if display dialog "Input description (optional):" default button 2 default answer "" set tmpDesc to result if the button returned of tmpDesc is not "OK" then return "" end if set theDesc to text returned of tmpDesc if theDesc is not "" then set theOptions to theOptions & "--form-string \"desc=" & theDesc & "\" " end if return "/usr/bin/curl -i https://upload.gyazo.com/api/upload -F \"access_token=" & theToken & "\" -F \"imagedata=@" & theImage & "\" " & theOptions end try end run
Access token has been set to {query}

require 'fileutils' token = "{query}"
data_path = ENV['alfred_workflow_data'] FileUtils.mkdir_p(data_path) unless FileTest.exist?(data_path)
begin access_token_path = File.join(data_path, ".gyazo_access_token") f = File.open(access_token_path, "w") f.write token f.close print data_path rescue print "Error" end

require 'fileutils'
cache_path = ENV['alfred_workflow_cache'] begin FileUtils.rm_rf Dir.glob(File.join(cache_path, "*")) if File.exist?(cache_path) print "true" rescue print "false" end
Run this only when you have made changes to many existing images
Error: No cache to clear exists
Get URL if called from web browser
